meanings.definition: The partially shaded outer region of a shadow cast by an opaque object.
meanings.sent1: The penumbra of the tree provided a cool spot to rest.
meanings.sent2: The penumbra of the building stretched across the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The penumbra of the umbrella made the perfect spot for a picnic.
meanings.sent4: The penumbra of doubt lingered in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The penumbra of the clouds created a beautiful pattern on the ground.

meanings.definition: A surrounding or enveloping atmosphere or environment.
meanings.sent1: The penumbra of excitement filled the room before the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The penumbra of mystery surrounded the old mansion.
meanings.sent3: The penumbra of laughter echoed through the hallways.
meanings.sent4: The penumbra of love enveloped them in a warm embrace.
meanings.sent5: The penumbra of fear hung heavy in the air during the horror movie.
